title: Shigeru Miyamoto
summary: Shigeru Miyamoto[lower-alpha 1] (pronounced [mijamoto ɕiɡeɾɯ]; born November 16, 1952)[3] is a Japanese video game designer, producer and game director at Nintendo, where he serves as one of its representative directors. He is the creator of some of the most acclaimed and best-selling game franchises of all time, including Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Donkey Kong, Star Fox and Pikmin. He is widely regarded as one of the most accomplished and influential designers in the history of video games.
